member.name: T:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToVisibilityConverter
member.summary:
XAML mark up extension to convert an image enum value into a visibility value. This class is used to decide whether an image is shown or not.
The converter returns if the MsgBoxImage != MsgBoxImage.None, otherwise is returned.

member.name: M:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToVisibilityConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Standard Constructor

member.name: M:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToVisibilityConverter.ProvideValue(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary:
When implemented in a derived class, returns an object that is provided as the value of the target property for this markup extension.
When a XAML processor processes a type node and member value that is a markup extension, it invokes the ProvideValue method of that markup extension and writes the result into the object graph or serialization stream. The XAML object writer passes service context to each such implementation through the serviceProvider parameter.

member.name: M:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToVisibilityConverter.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Null to visibility conversion method

member.name: M:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToVisibilityConverter.SetImageSource(MsgBox.MsgBoxImage)
member.summary: This function does the actual conversion from enum to .
member.returns: Visibility.Collapsed for MsgBoxImage.None or Visibility.Visible for all others.

member.name: M:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToVisibilityConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Visibility to Null conversion method (is not implemented)

member.name: T:MsgBox.Converter.ImageEnumToImageConverter
member.summary:
XAML mark up extension to convert a null value into a visibility value. This class is used to decide whether text document related controls, such as, highlighting patterns is shown or not.
The converter returns if the currently Active document is a text file that can be highlighted and otherwise.

The XAML object writer passes service context to each such implementation through the serviceProvider parameter.

member.name: T:MsgBox.Internal.ViewModel.Base.BaseViewModel
member.summary:
Every ViewModel class is required to implement the INotifyPropertyChanged interface in order to tell WPF when a property changed (for instance, when a method or setter is executed).
Therefore, the PropertyChanged methode has to be called when data changes, because the relevant properties may or may not be bound to GUI elements, which in turn have to refresh their display.
The PropertyChanged method is to be called by the members and properties of the class that derives from this class. Each call contains the name of the property that has to be refreshed.
The BaseViewModel is derived from from System.Windows.DependencyObject to allow resulting ViewModels the implemantion of dependency properties. Dependency properties in turn are useful when working with IValueConverter and ConverterParameters.

member.name: E:MsgBox.Internal.ViewModel.Base.BaseViewModel.PropertyChanged
member.summary: Standard event handler of the interface

member.name: M:MsgBox.Internal.ViewModel.Base.BaseViewModel.NotifyPropertyChanged``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}})
member.summary:
Tell bound controls (via WPF binding) to refresh their display.
Sample call: this.NotifyPropertyChanged(() => this.IsSelected); where 'this' is derived from and IsSelected is a property.

member.name: M:MsgBox.Internal.ViewModel.Base.BaseViewModel.OnPropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary:
Tell bound controls (via WPF binding) to refresh their display.
Sample call: this.OnPropertyChanged("IsSelected"); where 'this' is derived from and IsSelected is a property.
member.param: Name of property to refresh

member.name: T:MsgBox.Internal.ViewModel.MsgBoxViewModel
member.summary:
Source: http://blogsprajeesh.blogspot.de/2009/12/wpf-messagebox-custom-control-updated.html http://prajeeshprathap.codeplex.com/sourcecontrol/list/patches?ProjectName=prajeeshprathap
A viewmodel that drives an advanced message box dialog window through its life cycle. This message box supports: - Custom images - Help Link Navigation for advanced research in online resources (by the user) - (Expander) section with more textual/technical details

Determines whether user can close dialog via Esc, F4, or Window close button (X)

member.summary: Get/set property to determine the text for displaying a help link. By default the text is the toString content of the but it can also be a different text if that text is set in the constructor.

member.summary: Get property to determine whether a helplink should be display or not. A helplink should not be displayed if there is no HelpLink information available, and it can be dispalyed otherwise.

member.summary: Get property to get all textual information in one text block. This property is typically used to copy all text (even details) to the clipboard so users can paste it into their email and send the problem description off to those who care and know...

member.name: M:MsgBox.Internal.ViewModel.MsgBoxViewModel.MessageBox_Closing(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs)
member.summary:
Message box result is not set if dialog view is closed via F4, Window X button (standard chrome) so we determine whether the dialog is allowed to close via these 'hidden' mechanics and cancel it if not.
Otherwise, we set the result to default result here.

member.summary: Display a standard image indicating an important information.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxImage.Process_Stop
member.summary: Display a standard image indicating the end of a process run or program exit.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxImage.None
member.summary: Do not show an image at all.

member.name: T:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult
member.summary: This enumeration describes the possible results from displaying a message. A result is directly equivalent to a GUI element (OK, Cancel, Yes, No button) that a user clicked to close the message view.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.None
member.summary: This is mostly technically needed for properties that implement automatic magic, such as, setting a useful default button. This magic occurs only if this default parameter is set in the constructor/interface - otherwise the button set by the caller is used.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.NoDefaultButton
member.summary:
This can be used to tell the messagebox sub-system explicitly to not set any default button (which is rather un-uasual but possible if the user needs to determine somthing that has a real 50:50 chance of being ansered).
This Enum member can only be set in the defaultbutton parameter of the constructor but will never appear as actual result of a messagebox display.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.OK
member.summary: The result value of the message box is OK.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.Cancel
member.summary: The result value of the message box is Cancel.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.Yes
member.summary: The result value of the message box is Yes.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.No
member.summary: The result value of the message box is No.

member.name: F:MsgBox.MsgBoxResult.Close
member.summary: The result value of the message box is Close.

member.name: T:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys
member.summary: Resource key management class to keep track of all resources that can be re-styled in applications that make use of the implemented controls.

member.name: F:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys.ControlAccentColorKey
member.summary: Accent Color Key - This Color key is used to accent elements in the UI (e.g.: Color of Activated Normal Window Frame, ResizeGrip, Focus or MouseOver input elements)

member.name: F:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys.ControlAccentBrushKey
member.summary: Accent Brush Key - This Brush key is used to accent elements in the UI (e.g.: Color of Activated Normal Window Frame, ResizeGrip, Focus or MouseOver input elements)

member.name: F:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys.MsgBox_MessageColor
member.summary: Brush key of the message text shown in the message box.

member.name: F:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys.MsgBoxDialog_BackgroundKey
member.summary: Brush key of the background of the message box dialog.

member.name: F:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys.MsgBoxView_BackgroundKey
member.summary: Brush key of the background of the message view inside the message box dialog.

member.name: F:MsgBox.Themes.ResourceKeys.MsgBoxView_ForegroundKey
member.summary: Brush key of the foreground of the message view inside the message box dialog.
